data.title: Manufactured Cannabis Licensing Training Sessions
data.author: Department of Cannabis Control
data.excerpt: The California Department of Public Health’s Manufactured Cannabis Safety Branch (MCSB) will host 10 licensing training sessions throughout the state in November and December 2017.

content.rendered:
The California Department of Public Health’s Manufactured Cannabis Safety Branch (MCSB) will host 10 licensing training sessions throughout the state in November and December 2017. These trainings will assist licensees in better understanding the regulatory requirements, license application process, and commonly asked questions.

Two separate sessions will be held in each location, and all sessions will be the same. For all locations, the first session will be held from 9 to 11 a.m., and the second session will be held from 1 to 3 p.m. Space is limited to the first 250 people. You do not need to register to attend.

MCSB Licensing Training Sessions

November 28 – Eureka

Sequoia Conference Center, 901 Myrtle Avenue, Eureka, 95501

November 30 – Sacramento Area

Doubletree Hotel, 2001 Point W Way, Sacramento CA 95815

December 4 – San Diego

Crown Plaza, 2270 Hotel Circle N, San Diego CA 92108

December 11 – Oakland

Radisson Hotel, 8400 Edes Ave, Oakland CA 94621

December 12 – San Francisco

Doubletree Hotel, 835 Airport Blvd, Burlingame CA 94010

December 13 – Monterey

Hilton Garden Inn, 1000 Aguajito Road, Monterey CA 93940

December 18 – Los Angeles

TBD

December 19 – Lynwood 

TBD

December 20 – Desert Hot Springs

Miracle Springs Resort & Spa, 10625 Palm Drive, Desert Hot Springs, CA 92240

December 27 – Central Valley

TBD

Additional information about the cannabis manufacturing regulations and licensing process can be found on our website. For more information about the state cannabis licensing authorities, visit the Cannabis Portal.
